newsitem.title: UK: UK govt to propose timetabling of finance bill.
newsitem.headline: UK govt to propose timetabling of finance bill.

text.p: The government will propose to parliament on Monday that discussion of the finance bill implementing Chancellor Gordon Brown's budget should be subject to a parliamentary timetable, or "guillotine", Leader of the Commons Ann Taylor said on Thursday.
The announcement was bitterly denounced by her Conservative opposite number, Gillian Shephard, who accused the government of trying to stifle debate.
Contrasting the announcement with government promises of more open, consultative government, Shephard told Taylor: "You have put yourself in a ludicrous position."
Taylor did not immediately give full details of the government's so-called "guillotine motion".
She said that provided business in the Commons proceeds smoothly, she expects the House to rise for the summer recess on July 31. -- London Newsroom +44 171 5427767
